info.description: API endpoints that the Paxful Trading Bot will expose to the outside world.
info.title: Paxful Trading Bot

get.summary: Simple ping endpoint to see if it's up and running

post.summary: Indicate that a buyer wants to start a trade with the bot
post.description: This should be triggered by paxful.com when the user has inserted their preferred currency, amount, and payment method, and clicked "Buy Bitcoin now" and before it displays the results.

404.description: no offers matching input parameters were found

requestBody.description: Information the bot needs to fetch the best offer from sellers

get.summary: Get all info the Bot has about an ongoing trade

parameters.name: proxy_trade_id
parameters.description: ID of the bot trade as returned by the '/api/start' endpoint

200.description: successful operation. This will in the end have more fields than specified here; this is just to give an idea of what it will have.

404.description: proxy trade with that ID not found

currency.description: Currency code of the currency the user wishes to use as payment method

amount.description: Amount of currency the user wishes to exchange for BitCoin

payment_method.description: The payment method with which the user wishes to pay for the BitCoin

proxy_trade_id.description: Unique ID of the internal "ProxyTrade" object the Bot uses to track the status of a trade. This will be needed later in the flow for cancelling a trade and adding buyer's info.

offer_details.description: JSON containing the details of the best offer the bot found. Shape of the object corresponds to the one outlined in paxful.readthedocs.io/endpoints/offer/.

id.description: unique ID of the bot trade

started_at.description: UTC time when the current trade was started

ended_at.description: UTC time when the current trade was completed

user_id.description: ID of the buyer of the trade

seller_id.description: ID of the GLP of the trade
